City of Clewiston Announces Call for Local Artists for America's Sweetest Town & The Gateway to Lake Okeechobee Murals
News Release Date
08-07-2025
Back to News
The City of Clewiston is excited to announce a unique opportunity for artists to participate in a landmark mural project that honors both our agricultural legacy and the vital role of Lake Okeechobee. This mural will celebrate our community's rich farming history while also highlighting the lake's importance as a natural habitat for fish, wading birds, and other wildlife, as well as its essential role in supplying water for our people, farms, and the environment.
This call for artists is open to both well-established and emerging muralists skilled in large-scale painting, mural techniques, surface preparation, and finishing methods. Artists from Clewiston and surrounding areas are strongly encouraged to apply.
As part of the selection process, you will need to submit a draft of your mural proposal based on one or both of the following concepts: 'America's Sweetest Town,' which reflects Clewiston's vibrant agricultural history, and 'The Gateway to Lake Okeechobee,' highlighting the lake's significance as a natural habitat. Proposals can be hand-drawn or digitally created. We encourage all artists to visit the
City’s museum
to explore and gain inspiration from Clewiston's rich history.
Application Requirements
Interested artists must submit the following materials with their application:
Three (3) examples of previous mural projects.
Three (3) references from former clients.
An estimated timeline for project completion.
Draft of your mural proposal/s
Applications must be submitted by September 8, 2025.
For additional information regarding the application process or project details, please contact the city's communications department at
communications
[at]
clewiston-fl.gov
(
communications[at]clewiston-fl[dot]gov
)
The City of Clewiston looks forward to receiving applications from talented artists to contribute to this historic project.
City of Clewiston, Florida
Proudly Serving America’s Sweetest Town

CRA Grant Program
News Release Date
07-18-2025
Back to News
The City of Clewiston encourages local business owners to take advantage of the CRA Grant Program
, which supports exterior renovations of existing business buildings within the Community Redevelopment Agency (CRA) area. This initiative aims to enhance our community, strengthen local businesses, and create more opportunities for residents. The city also offers assistance with the application process for anyone who needs help. Together, we can improve our community and foster a thriving environment for all.
Application
As part of its outreach to business owners, Clewiston’s Community Redevelopment Agency (CRA) offers technical and financial assistance for the exterior renovation of existing business buildings located within the Community Redevelopment Area (CRA). The program's goal is to support the implementation of the Community Redevelopment Plan, encouraging improvements through financial incentives aligned with Land Development Codes and Design Guidelines.
The term “façade” is used broadly. While the program focuses on exterior improvements, it may cover a range of eligible enhancements, not limited to storefront façades.
Program Objective
By improving the visual appearance of downtown Clewiston, the CRA aims to:
Attract new businesses and construction projects.
Support the expansion of existing businesses.
Create a more inviting environment for customers and investors.
Eligibility and Funding
Who is Eligible?
Owners of existing business buildings located within the redevelopment area.
Businesses must be conforming uses under CRA and City codes.
More information:
https://www.clewiston-fl.gov/community-redevelopment-agency/page/cra-fa…
Print
Community Redevelopment Agency

CRA Ordinances
Clewiston Community Redevelopment Plan

Events
Event
The City of Clewiston warmly welcomes residents and citizens interested in hosting special events! We appreciate the opportunity to support your initiatives and foster community engagement. To ensure a smooth planning process, please submit your
EVENT APPLICATION
,
along with the required fee, at least four weeks prior to the event date. For more details, please refer to the application. We look forward to partnering with you to make your event a success!
Food Trucks
Absent of an approved city special event permit, a food truck can only operate on Mondays and Tuesdays between the hours of 11:00am and 8:00pm and only on commercial or industrial-zoned property. The truck also needs the written permission of the property owner and must produce the written document upon demand.
Absent of written permission, a food truck cannot operate within 200 feet of an existing food establishment while the food establishment is open.
For more information see
ORDINANCE NO. 2024-14

Citizen Boards
Citizen boards and committees play an important role in local government and serve as a vital link between the community and its elected officials. While you will find that your role on a citizen board requires time, effort and some night meetings, it is also a rewarding and challenging experience.
Clewiston's Citizen Boards:
Community Redevelopment Advisory Board
Clewiston Library Advisory Board
Hendry County Library Cooperative Advisory Board
Planning and Zoning Board
Board of Building Commissioners
Municipal Golf Course Advisory Committee
Parks, Recreation & Leisure Services Advisory Board
Area Housing Commission of Clewiston, LaBelle and Hendry County
Auditor Selection Committee
Firefighter Pension Board
The City is currently seeking board/committee members for the following boards:
Area Housing Commission of Clewiston, LaBelle and Hendry County Board
Firefighter Pension Board
Municipal Golf Course Advisory Committee
All board/committee members must be City residents. If you are interested in serving the community in this capacity, please complete an application
Citizen Board Appointment Application
and return it to City Hall.

Citizen boards and committees play an important role in local government and serve as a vital link between the community and its elected officials. While you will find that your role on a citizen board requires time, effort and some night meetings, it is also a rewarding and challenging experience.
Clewiston's Citizen Boards:
Community Redevelopment Advisory Board
Clewiston Library Advisory Board
Hendry County Library Cooperative Advisory Board
Planning and Zoning Board
Board of Building Commissioners
Municipal Golf Course Advisory Committee
Parks, Recreation & Leisure Services Advisory Board
Area Housing Commission of Clewiston, LaBelle and Hendry County
Auditor Selection Committee
Firefighter Pension Board
The City is currently seeking board/committee members for the following boards:
Area Housing Commission of Clewiston, LaBelle and Hendry County Board
Firefighter Pension Board
Municipal Golf Course Advisory Committee
All board/committee members must be City residents. If you are interested in serving the community in this capacity, please complete an application
Citizen Board Appointment Application
and return it to City Hall.
